means: 打鞭挞( swinge的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: There have been swingeing cuts on government subsidies, on housing, food and fuel.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府已经大幅度削减了其在住房、食品和燃料方面的补贴。

sentence.Network_en: These powers are neither as new or as swingeing as ministers suggest, however.
sentence.Network_cn: 然而,这些权利不如大臣们建议的那么新, 那么有力.

entry.tran: (抨击等)尖锐的,猛烈的;(削减)大幅度的，严重的
entry.def: A swingeing action, such as an attack or cut, is very great or severe.

example.ex: ...the book mounted a swingeing attack on the materialist, growth-oriented economics of the day...
example.tran: 该书对当今追逐实利、以增长为导向的经济学进行了猛烈的抨击

example.ex: There have been swingeing cuts on government subsidies, on housing, food and fuel.
example.tran: 政府已经大幅度削减了其在住房、食品和燃料方面的补贴。

auth_sentence.content: He introduced swingeing increases in taxation.
